brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators' hypothesis is that patients with apical ballooning syndrome (ABS) will
      manifest a personality profile that differs than that of a population of similar range of
      ethnic and socioeconomic status.

clinical_study.brief_title: Personality Profile of Patients With Apical Ballooning Syndrome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:

          1. Patients who have suffered with ABS

          2. Adults (18 years or older)

          3. Able to read English at a 6th grade level (questionnaires are self-administered and
             written in English)

        Exclusion criteria:

          1. Have withdrawn from the registry

          2. Have died

study_pop.textblock:
This study will be conducted among participants in the Mayo Clinic Apical Ballooning
        Registry. These patients were prospectively diagnosed with Apical Ballooning Syndrome at
        the time of presentation with their acute illness, and consented to participation in a
        registry. They are residents of Olmsted County, and the surrounding regions for which the
        Mayo Clinic serves as a tertiary care center. Enrollment in the registry requires
        satisfaction of standard criteria for the diagnosis of ABS and includes the administration
        of a standardized questionnaire.  Subjects have agreed to participate in yearly follow up
        questionnaires about their health status.

clinical_study.official_title: Personality Profile of Patients With Apical Ballooning Syndrome (ABS)

primary_outcome.description:
The "NEO PI-3" measures the five major domains of personality, which are:
Neuroticism
Extraversion
Openness
Agreeableness
Conscientiousness
primary_outcome.measure: Range of personality traits as assessed by the "NEO-PI-3"
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline: the traits will be assessed once upon enrollment into the study

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
